title: Benidorm star Julie Graham marries toyboy four years after husband's tragic death
text:

Benidorm actress Julie Graham has married her toyboy partner four years after her first husband's tragic death.

The TV star wed Davy Crockett, who is 16 years younger than her, in a ceremony in Brighton watched by her close friends and family.

Julie, who plays Sheron Dawson in the ITV comedy, was left heartbroken in 2015 when her husband Joseph Bennett committed suicide in a park in south west London

They had been married for 13 years.

(Image: Instagram)

Julie was cast in Benidorm the same month as Joseph’s suicide, playing the matriarch of a new family in the series.

A year later she met Davy, a Belgian skydiving instructor partner, while she was filming Benidorm and previously spoke about unexpectedly falling in love.

The Scottish actress told The Sun: "He’s just lovely, gorgeous and he makes me happy.

"Meeting somebody was the last thing I wanted to do. I was adamant that I wanted to spend some time on my own.

(Image: Instagram)

"Although the year was very difficult in some ways, it has been really positive too.

"I got an amazing job in Benidorm."

The actress was raised along by her mother Betty in Irvine, Ayrshire. When she was in her late teens her mother died of lung cancer, aged 50, six months after being diagnosed.

The tragedy of her mother’s death spurred her to move to London and become an actress. When she first arrived she got a job working on the doors at a Soho strip club, before she landed a role on Casualty, where she played a student nurse.

Julie has also appeared alongside Martin Clues in William and Mary, a romantic comedy drama involving an undertaker and a midwife, which was nominated for a Bafta in 2004.

She briefly dated Liam Neeson before he met and married his late wife Natasha Richardson.

The newlyweds live with Julie's two daughters Edie May and Betty in Brighton.
